sentences.sentence: Hello, you're watching Euronews now. Let's take a look at the latest headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A raft of new Covid measures are introduced in France, Austria and parts of Germany as cases continue to soar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But in England, authorities rule out a revision of restrictions before the new year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Belarus puts forward draft amendments to the country's constitution that could see President Lukashenko remain in power until 2035.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Proof of vaccination will be necessary to enter restaurants, bars, cinemas and other public venues from January 15th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: While the wait time between the second vaccine and the booster shot has also been reduced to just three months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: New restrictions to tackle a rise in coronavirus infections will come into force across large parts of Germany on December 28th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Vaccinated people can meet privately in groups of 10, while the unvaccinated can only meet in pairs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile across the border in Austria, where a lockdown for the unvaccinated is still in place, the hospitality sector will be required to stop service at 10pm. This will affect New Year's Eve events and will come as a blow for many business owners. This local cafe owner says an earlier closing time always means less business. It's getting harder and harder. While Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland have put limits on social gatherings in time for New Year's Eve, 10 Downing Street says no new steps will be taken in England before the new year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Boris Johnson has instead emphasised the importance of personal responsibility.

sentences.sentence: as well as the unvaccinated so changing? Well, gatherings of vaccinated and recently recovered people will be limited to 10. But if an unvaccinated person is present, only one other household is allowed to attend. Spectators are also banned from sporting events, cultural shows, concerts and other large public events. Fireworks for New Year's Eve celebrations have also been banned and nightclubs are required to close across the country.

On Monday night, thousands of demonstrators in several parts of the country protested against the new measures as well as the vaccine mandate for health care workers.

sentences.sentence: The decision follows an ongoing assault on Russian civil society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As President Vladimir Putin continues to crack down on free speech and opposition leaders such as Alexei Navalny, NGOs and media outlets have been called foreign agents and hit with fines and closures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Memorial International was founded in the late 1980s to document political repression and the darkest chapters of Soviet history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Containing a vast database of victims, the organisation sought to preserve the memory of millions of victims persecuted under the Soviet Union.

sentences.sentence: At least 20 people have been killed in floods that have plagued northeastern Brazil since November, according to local officials. Incessant torrents have also displaced almost 63,000 people. Two new fatalities were recorded in the town of Itabuna in the state of Bahia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's the highest weekly number of infections recorded since figures began circulating in May of last year. This comes as over 15,000 tests were carried out between December 20th and December 26th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Authorities in Belarus have released a draft document proposing changes to the country's constitution. They could allow President Alexander Lukashenko to further tighten his grip on power and remain in office until 2035. The proposed amendments have been published on the official presidential website and the website of state news agency Belter. Citizens are encouraged to submit comments, suggestions and opinions the amendments would reinstate presidential term limits that had been abolished during lukashenko's tenure allowing a president only two five-year terms in office but the restriction will only take effect once a newly elected president assumes office giving giving Lukashenko the opportunity to run for two more terms after his current term expires in 2025.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Other changes to the constitution include extending the parliament's term from four years to five, and granting former presidents immunity from prosecution over actions they took while in office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The amendments will be put to a referendum scheduled for February 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: They'll be approved if more than 50% vote for them, with a turnout of 50%.

To bring the GCPOA back to life means again, GCPOA means sanctions lifted from the United States, nuclear commitments from Iran. And this is what we are working. Any other speculation on other possibilities is not something that is now here on the table. Here on the table the only thing we have is how to negotiate a text that will include practical steps from Iran and from the United States to go back to full compliance.

sentences.sentence: Iran's petrochemical industry, the mainstay of its economy, has suffered greatly since the resumption of US sanctions in 2018. It hopes that a deal can revive its financial position.

Hezbollah syria iraq and the terrorist network they have deployed around the world at the heart of this dispute is iran's nuclear capabilities which its leaders insisted for civilian purposes it's closer to achieving the material required for a bomb now than in 2015.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: No new metal has been produced here since the beginning of October, putting jobs at risk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Well, the mood is somewhat depressing at the moment because 120 colleagues will get fired.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And actually we still have hope in the plant that we can continue here." Electricity usually accounts for up to 40 percent of the cost of producing aluminium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Analysts say that gas prices are the main driver behind surging power costs in Europe, while the cost of permits in Europe's carbon market has contributed up to a fifth of the increase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Well, the prices were very high in October because of the recovery of the economy and the lifting of the lockdowns and the increase in demand for gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But now we see that it is mainly due to geopolitical tensions with Russia, because most of the gas we get in Europe comes from Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Dutch industry has been hit particularly hard, as unlike Germany and France, it has no program to compensate energy-intensive industries for costs due to higher European prices for carbon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At least 5,200 migratory cranes of the half million which travel through Israel on their way to Africa, lie dead in the Hula Valley as authorities struggle to contain the site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A spokesperson for the Hula Lake Park said the workers were removing carcasses as quickly as possible to prevent infections from spreading to its other wildlife. This year an estimated 30,000 cranes remained in the country for the winter. It is believed that those infected caught it from poultry coops. An agricultural ministry spokesman said half a million chickens in the area were to be slaughtered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: La vita is not so bella for Italy's tourism industry. The Mediterranean country usually

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: attracts tourists in droves from all around the world. But as the year comes to a close, figures show that only 60 million tourists visited Italy this year compared to over 100 million in 2019 Carlo Sangali the president of the Conf Commercio Association raised the alarming statistics to the Italian government appealing for more support such as extensions to the unemployment payment scheme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sangali added that it was unthinkable for an Italian economy to function without the tourism sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Covid restrictions and general fears surrounding travel during the pandemic have undoubtedly caused such stark figures. The country already requires unvaccinated EU citizens to quarantine for five days if entering the country, while vaccinated visitors from the EU must get a negative test within 24 hours of arrival. Aside from bars and restaurants, Italy's ski sector is also looking at another tough winter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Currently tourists can ski in the country as long as they have a validated green pass, but as cases rise within northern regions, tougher measures may be introduced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This leaves further uncertainty for ski resorts' profits, as all they can do is hope.
